001package com.technototes.library.hardware;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareMap;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.Map;
006import java.util.Set;
007
008/**
009 * Class for hardware devices
010 * This just adds an extra layer of indirection that doesn't feel like it's worth the hassle.
011 *
012 * @param <T> The class for the default device (ones found in ftcsdk)
013 * @author Alex Stedman
014 */
015@SuppressWarnings("unused")
016public abstract class HardwareDevice<T extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice> {
017
018    /**
019     * Hardware map object for stuff
020     */
021    public static HardwareMap hardwareMap = null;
022    protected static Map<String, HardwareDevice<?>> names = new HashMap<>();
023
024    public static void initMap(HardwareMap h) {
025        hardwareMap = h;
026    }
027
028    public static Set<HardwareDevice<?>> devices = null;
029
030    private T device;
031
032    /**
033     * The name of the hardware used for logging & hardware creation
034     */
035    protected String name;
036
037    public String getName() {
038        return name;
039    }
040
041    /**
042     * Make a hardware device
043     *
044     * @param device The default device
045     */
046    public HardwareDevice(T device, String deviceName) {
047        this.device = device;
048        name = deviceName;
049        names.put(deviceName, this);
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Make a hardware device with the string to get from hardwaremap
054     *
055     * @param deviceName The device name
056     */
057    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked cast")
058    protected HardwareDevice(String deviceName) {
059        device =
060            hardwareMap.tryGet((Class<T>) com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.HardwareDevice.class/*T.class*/, deviceName);
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Get encapsulated device
065     *
066     * @return The device
067     */
068    protected T getRawDevice() {
069        // TODO: Assert that we've got a device, yeah?
070        return device;
071    }
072
073    protected boolean realHardware() {
074        return device != null;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Get the logging expression
079     */
080    protected String logData(String info) {
081        return String.format("%s: %s", name, info);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * This is used for logging stuff by name and/or device type
086     * @return
087     */
088    public abstract String LogLine();
089}
